data.title: Fix build error on master, commit aaf6ae3
Option to expand inspector sections by default
data.body:
**Godot version: Master 36548a3fa**


**Issue description:**
The new collapsible sections on the inspector are cool, but all start collapsed and if you need to find a specific property you need to remember to which class it belongs or expand all, every time (depending on the volatility of the user's memory).
This may not help new users either.

An option for having sections expanded by default on the inspector could be useful.

data.title: Laggy dock resizing, dragging split in editor low fps
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
current master
macOS

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
dragging the split to resize different editor docks is slow/laggy compared to 2.1

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open godot 3.0 resize the right or left dock section. It will render with less than 10 fps.


## Things we know (would be good to know):
 - [x] This issue is not existing in the 2.1 version from the website
 - [x] Also present in release compile
 - [x] drawing texture style boxes needs less number calculations on the cpu when redrawn. (styleBoxFlat needs to calculate the size and position for multiple rectangles. This gets even more complex with the new style boxFlat (rounded borders)
 - [x] there is no noticeable difference in performance when I test it with the more complex calculations of the new style box. (taking all that into consideration, it does not seem like the lag has anything to do with the actual style box drawing)
 - [ ] the lag was introduced when switching to the new renderer in the viewport.
 - [x] the lag is much bigger when resizing the editor in a way that the main viewport gets resized.
 - [x] **probably has something to do with the input system**
I marked things in the list which I know. the rest are more or the less questions which, when answered would help finding the issue for the low performance.

@volzhs maybe you have already discovered additional information.

data.title: Raycasts (2D) and one side collision shapes issue
data.body:
**Godot version: 2.1.x, 3 (master)**


**Issue description:**
Raycasts collide against one side collision shapes when is not supposed to.

Rectangle shapes and similar collide on all the area, polygon shapes only collide on the border.

Polygon shapes get hit on the borders.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Cast a ray or use Raycast2D in a place where is not supposed to hit a one side collision shape.

Character script on the Platformer demo uses a raycast to detect ground and can be used to test (the effect is barely noticeable in the platforms because are too thin).

![onesideraybug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/27610488-e1b4683a-5b64-11e7-8e31-50f632b397bd.gif)


**Link to minimal example project:**
Simple project that uses RayCast2D:
Godot 2:
[rayonesidebug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1106836/rayonesidebug.zip)

Godot 3:
[rayonesidebugv3.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1106837/rayonesidebugv3.zip)

data.title: Pixel Bleeding
data.body:
Running Godot 2.1.3v.stable.official

When using sub-pixel positioning, the texture of a sprite occasionally bleeds in values from the surrounding pixels in the spritesheet. 

Bleeding:
![bleed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13801432/27609550-142a63a0-5b83-11e7-9742-bdfe5f0c9356.gif)

Spritesheet:
![bleed2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13801432/27609569-237477e2-5b83-11e7-8f5f-10ec6fb336c9.PNG)

I _believe_ this is a sampling issue in the texture shader used in the engine - you should sample from the center of the pixel, rather than the corner. The theory is reinforced by the fact that  if I remove the borders from around the icons (creating a transparent border of 1 pixel for each one) the issue appears to be fixed.

In short, when sampling (0,0,10,10) should become (0.5,0.5,9.5,9.5) and this should be fixed.

data.title: Curve loading is broken
data.body:
@Zylann This check seems wrong

ERROR: set_data: Condition ' input[i + 3].get_type() != Variant::INT ' is true.
   At: scene/resources/curve.cpp:733.

Also, this does not really make much sense in curve.h:

#ifdef TOOLS_ENABLED
	bool _disable_set_data;
#endif

Just put this boolean in the curve editor so it does not update, not in curve.

data.title: Subtle native-run buttons
data.body:
- Use custom run-icons for Android and HTML5 platforms
  
  ![native-run](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6996191/27605036-a0dfb1c2-5b7b-11e7-8256-02c387c7fd64.png)

- Hide HTML5 run-icon when no runnable preset is available
  
  Displaying the Android run button while Android devices are plugged in, regardless of presets, makes sense for discoverability. But for HTML5, the button is always shown, which is annoying unless one actually wants to export to HTML5 and has a runnable export preset configured.

Resolves #8836

data.title: Windows placement review (project manager, editor run, exported game)
data.body:
Over the years we have had various issues about the placement of Godot's windows, sometimes contradictory and with partial platform-specific or configuration-bound fixes. All in all it's pretty hard to have a good overview of what is happening *today*, so starting this issue to gather the information. I will close all other issues on this topic and point to this one.

Godot spawns different kind of windows, with different behaviours for each window and each platform:
- Project manager
- Editor window
- Running game in editor (placement can be configured in Editor Settings, should default to Centered)
- Running game outside of editor, with editor binary (run Godot in the project folder)
- Exported game

I want to know what is the behaviour on all desktop platforms for those 5 kinds of windows:
- Where does the window spawn?
- Does it "jump" from one location to another (e.g. start appearing top left and then jump in the center before rendering)?
- Anything else that seems relevant

And having the status for both the *master* branch and the *2.1* branch would be nice.

So you get the test matrix, 3 platforms, 5 types of windows, 2 behaviours to describe, 2 branches.

Output below (lots of warnings too, but I won't post those unless desired):
`Error	C1083	Cannot open include file: 'splash.gen.h': No such file or directory	godot	godot\main\main.cpp	42	`
`Error	MSB3073	The command "echo Starting SCons && cmd /V /C set "plat=x86" ^& (if "x86"=="x64" (set "plat=x86_amd64")) ^& set "tools=yes" ^& (if "debug"=="release" (set "tools=no")) ^& call "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\vcvarsall.bat" !plat! ^& scons platform=windows target=debug tools=!tools! -j2" exited with code 2.	godot	C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V140\Microsoft.MakeFile.Targets	41	`

data.title: Implemented borderless window code for OSX.
data.body: With this patch it's possible to start a project with the borderless window flag, or use the set_borderless_window function to set/unset the flag. Tested on OSX Yosemite.

data.title: CanvasItem culling performance issue
data.body:
Godot 2.1.3

In connection to a project i am working on where i had some performance issues, i did some tests to see what impact a lot of instanced nodes have on performance. Thanks to @bojidar-bg for discussing this with me on IRC.

I tested by creating a new project, and just add a lot of nodes to a scene.
I found that the first 100 nodes inheriting from CanvasItem that i add to my scene drops my FPS by ~50% and on the other side if i add the first 100 spatial nodes (with camera so they render) my FPS drop by ~20%

I am not sure the Node2D / Spatial comparison is that relevant, but it helped getting to the conclusion that it is CanvasItem.

Next up i tried creating a TileMap and  filling 100 tiles from a TileSet and setting the Quadrant size to respectively 1 and 100, and sure enough when Quadrant size is set so it only draw and cull once i "only" drop about ~23%

Of course it has a lower impact when only drawing/culling once, but my point is that a ~50% FPS drop on 100 empty Node2D's seems like a lot.


I created a log of our conversation on IRC if interested (removed everything not related to this topic):
https://pastebin.com/2BR1EKZX

> bojidar_bg: I think you should open an issue about it, so that we might look at how culling can be improved (by using spatial hashing or quadtrees)


Whether this is a big performance issue or it is rather small i am not 100% sure about, but i think it would be interesting with some further look into this.

I'll gladly elaborate on this if i haven't made it clear enough, and i am aware that more in-depth tests could be made, but hey, the prove a point ;)

data.title: Tilesets no longer keep its collisions, with either CollisionPolygon2D or CollisionShape2D and character goes right through them
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit Godot 3.0 commit 90592ccf03521cda14ee3a9576b671136da2021d

**Issue description:**
New Tilesets or old Tilesets with collisions defined and re-exported, loose their collisions and KinematicBody2D (character) goes right through, also their collisions are not being drawn

**Steps to reproduce:**
Get a Tileset scene from a couple of days ago that have working collisions or create a new one with a Sprite+StaticBody2D+CollisionPolygon2D, save the scene, export the scene as a Tileset
The collisions dont work anymore and the character can go right through the Tiles

data.title: Turning a tile into 1-side collision gives unexpected result (2.1.4b)
data.body:
**Godot version: 2.1.4 beta**

**Issue description:**
The one side tiles do not work as expected, for example [0,1] can allow to step on the lower part of the collision shape.

![onesidetile](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10215987/27563118-44e329e2-5aa6-11e7-8b64-b79c7a221fd7.gif)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Turn into one side (like [0,1]) an existing tile of a tileset and try to land in the middle of it.
Changing to different depth values does not alter anything on this behaviour.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Platformer demo can be used for this.

data.title: Editor randomly freezes after Save & Quit on save_each_scene = false
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Antergos x86_64 | Godot Engine master 4e12bf1 

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Expected: editor to save and quit normally
Happened: editor freezes and won't quit after saving

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Set `interface/save_each_scene_on_quit` to `false`
2. Make two or more scenes, save to disk (issue seems less likely to happen when there's only one unsaved scene)
3. Make unsaved changes in those scenes
4. Try to exit the editor. The prompt should say the scenes' name.
5. Choose "Save & Quit"
6. The scenes will be saved but sometimes the editor will freeze and not quit

Edit: more investigation

Backtrace: 
```
<Click Save and Quit>
[Thread 0x7fffe8118700 (LWP 17571) exited]
<Editor freezes>
<Decide to end the process>
^C
Thread 1 "godot" received signal SIGINT, Interrupt.
0x00007ffff616343d in pthread_join () from /usr/lib/libpthread.so.0
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff616343d in pthread_join () from /usr/lib/libpthread.so.0
#1  0x000000000133cd9f in ThreadPosix::wait_to_finish_func_posix (p_thread=0x58bb260) at drivers/unix/thread_posix.cpp:99
#2  0x00000000024b3860 in Thread::wait_to_finish (p_thread=0x58bb260) at core/os/thread.cpp:58
#3  0x000000000150356b in EditorResourcePreview::~EditorResourcePreview (this=0x6abeb40, __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at editor/editor_resource_preview.cpp:415
#4  0x0000000000f77d0b in memdelete<Node> (p_class=0x6abeb40) at core/os/memory.h:109
#5  0x00000000019be637 in Node::_notification (this=0x513fe10, p_notification=1) at scene/main/node.cpp:165
#6  0x0000000000dac954 in Node::_notificationv (this=0x513fe10, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at ./scene/main/node.h:45
#7  0x000000000141fa35 in EditorNode::_notificationv (this=0x513fe10, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at editor/editor_node.h:94
#8  0x000000000244dafc in Object::notification (this=0x513fe10, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at core/object.cpp:849
#9  0x000000000244b19d in Object::_predelete (this=0x513fe10) at core/object.cpp:385
#10 0x0000000002455b6d in predelete_handler (p_object=0x513fe10) at core/object.cpp:1774
#11 0x0000000000f77ceb in memdelete<Node> (p_class=0x513fe10) at core/os/memory.h:107
#12 0x00000000019be637 in Node::_notification (this=0x4a481c0, p_notification=1) at scene/main/node.cpp:165
#13 0x0000000000dac954 in Node::_notificationv (this=0x4a481c0, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at ./scene/main/node.h:45
#14 0x0000000001a02d73 in Viewport::_notificationv (this=0x4a481c0, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at scene/main/viewport.h:89
#15 0x000000000244dafc in Object::notification (this=0x4a481c0, p_notification=1, p_reversed=true) at core/object.cpp:849
#16 0x000000000244b19d in Object::_predelete (this=0x4a481c0) at core/object.cpp:385
#17 0x0000000002455b6d in predelete_handler (p_object=0x4a481c0) at core/object.cpp:1774
#18 0x00000000019aa917 in memdelete<Viewport> (p_class=0x4a481c0) at core/os/memory.h:107
#19 0x00000000019998b0 in SceneTree::finish (this=0x46d5680) at scene/main/scene_tree.cpp:573
#20 0x0000000000d59563 in OS_X11::run (this=0x7fffffffe240) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:2113
#21 0x0000000000d4fdcc in main (argc=2, argv=0x7fffffffe768) at platform/x11/godot_x11.cpp:54    
```
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/9c3bddfac2d80b0e52b94eeace58dbfd249459e7/editor/editor_resource_preview.cpp#L411-L419

I'm fine with removing this option though, but this seems like a bug that needs to be fixed because it freezes for simply save all and quit.

data.title: KinematicBody2D. one way collision makes the character fall through when standing on an upward moving platform
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Ubuntu 64bit commit 36548a3fa58f00a3ef301f169f237b5641bdf635

**Issue description:**
 in OneWay collisions you can't set how far you can go inside the CollisionShape2D, and for moving platforms going upward, you always go throught the platform and fall, when the moving platform is moving downward or horizontally, you dont fall


**Steps to reproduce:**
set a KinematickBody2D with a CollisionShape2D and set the OneWay Collision checkbox on the shape make the shape move upward with set_transform and see your character fall through
